reviewText: I am a 52 old(9 year old) ex-smoker that has gained 30 pounds, I had walked over these past 9 years and have done various other exercise dvd's with weights and have had difficulty getting my old slim body back. First workout with this showed me how out of shape I am in, I was so sore the next day along with my 14 year old daughter, no pain no gain, right, right that is what one needs to become aware to the steps it requires to alter your muscles on a far deeper level, we are not giving up on this system of exercise we are going to master all 3 dvd's, first on the novice pay attention that after all the timed set routines there are more exercises you can do and the same goes for the 2nd. and 3rd dvd sets. We have been at this for about 2 weeks now and we can already "see" some minor changes, which is an excellent start. we intend to purchase his book and then in about a year his other dvd program.
summary: which is an excellent start. we intend to purchase his book and ...
Title: N/A

reviewText: The YAYOG book it great. I picked a bunch of exercises that I enjoy and try to do as many of them as I can in 45 minutes to an hour. The DVD is amazing. I do it on the days when I prefer to be guided. What is great about this DVD is that it gets to the point, Mark is not a celebrity trainer, doesn't shout or promote anything on it.Most workouts are 20 minutes or so, the cool down and warm ups are around 5 minutes each. This is basically a DVD that will grow with you as body weight exercises depend on your stamina. I like that Mark factors in cool down periods in between the moves. One thing I hate about workout DVDs is the pace is unsustainable for me.In the workouts there's a little timer so you know that you're making progress. Overall this DVD is perfect. Trust me, I have been doing body weight exercises based on YAYOG every other day for about two weeks now and I'm in seriously awesome shape. This works, you don't need anything crazy.

reviewText: If you are looking for a quick intense workout this is a nice program to get.It only takes about 15- 20 minutes per workout to complete.It's a nice body weight workout program with 3 different exercise levels on the disc.I did the beginners workout and it kicked my butt.

reviewText: I purchased this product as I had the book and was looking for a way to combine all the workouts into a logical progresssion.  The dvd is great especially for people as out of shape as I am I started working along with the dvd at the beginning of the year 2014 and am steadily progressing.  Very good especially as it is very inconvenient for me to go to  the gym thanks for great at home bodyweight workout products Mr Lauren
summary: Good compliment to book but can stand alone as well

Title: N/A

reviewText: I have been looking for a SHORT, no impact workout that I can do before work or at work.  I was hesitant to open this DVD because all the workouts that promise to be short end up being too long or don't get the heart rate up.  This DVD delivered.  The workout with the cool-down and warmup felt to be no more than 20 minutes.  My heart rate was to the sky though.  I can see  the workout getting boring but the workout is so short that boring should not be an issue.  A long workout being boring is un-doable.  I personally HOPE that a short workout with repetition can be done.I do DVDs until a point where I feel like results should be seen.  I will do this workout for 3 weeks to see if I see results and will post the update.Like:No impact; the squats are wide legged sumo squats so the impact on the knees is minimalThe swimmers are you lying on the floorThe cross legged arm and leg lifts are you on your kneeds, but you can use a towel or cushion to limit impact on the kneesNO mountain climbers are no impact; though they maybe difficult on the wrist and shouldersDid Not LikeI do think that each DVD should have 2 different sets of exercise for the novice, intermediate, and advanced; it would reduce the likelihood of burning out from repetitionWould I recommend? YESWhy? Because this workout is short, but the heart rate is through the roof and, if it is not enough, a person could just do the workout again for a 40 minute workoutUPDATE to followUpdate:There is another circuit training workout that I did not realize was on this DVD until I kept seeing it on youtube.  If you go to youtube, the circuit workout in full is on the website.As for this workout, if you do the whole workout, you heart rate will be high.  I burn about 100 calories since it is not an impact workout.  The main problem with me doing the workout consistently is that it is so boring to me.  I have found this month, due to a competition at my gym, that any exercise workout that involves a lot of repetition of the same moves bores me to tears.  If repetition does not bother you, you will see immediate results with YAYOG in terms of strength building in your arms and legs.
summary: Workout is SHORT but the sweat is long!
Title: N/A

reviewText: I must say, that I didn't know what to expect from this dvd. After reading the book, I was convinced that body-weight exercises isthe way to go and will become the norm here in the USA and abroad. I have never done body-weight exercises before, other than pushups & squat/lunges. I have used countless workout dvd's and this one is by far the best.Pro's:The workouts are short - 12min to 26min. It comes with 3 dvd's that covers Beginners, Intermediate & Advance. So far I am up to Intermediate, and let me tell you that after a workout, I am sweating and feel the soreness for 2 days.....which is great becauseit shows me that many muscle groups are at work and my heart rate during the workouts gets elevated without doing any cardio.After 4 weeks, I have lost 7 lbs., I feel stronger, by posture is better, my core is stronger and my lower back pains seem tohave vanished.I will never pick up a another dumbbell or barbell or do any form of weight training again. I am totally convinced and a followerof Body-weight training, just like our ancestors in Greece & Rome used to do. Thanks Mark Lauren for sharing this with us.Con's:Although it is necessary to do a warm-up & cool-down, I feel they are tooo long. 2 to 3 minutes of each would be sufficient. I wishthe dvd workouts were exactly the same as the book, because the book is great!!!! The workout routines in the book are awesome, but some of us ( like me ) need to view them on dvd to guide us through the workout.I totally recommend this dvd for anyone who really wants to workout at home or in the park or anywhere for that matter with 12 min to 26 min to spare, to get in shape, increase cardiovascular, lose weight, gain strength, add muscle mass, lose body fat, avoid the gym and fees, etc. You Are Your Own Gym Dvd Is For You. Buy It!!!!MJ
Title: N/A

reviewText: Mark Lauren is a great instructor. There are no fancy sets or gimmicks here. The emphasis is on getting a great workout in the shortest time possible, and YAYOG succeeds on all levels. Most of the exercises are multiple periods of 20-seconds on, and 20-seconds off. There are timed sets, ladders, and circuit training, for 3 levels of fitness: novice, intermediate, and advanced. There's something here for everyone. Again, I really like Mark Lauren's non-gimmicky style. He's encouraging without being annoying. I purchased both this and JCORE in recent months, and I really like both of them a bunch. They are abbreviated programs offering a great return with a minimal investment of time.
Title: N/A
